page.title: 09ATTITUDES OF LOCAL PEOPLE
page.content: MANY YOUNGER PEOPLE WOULD LIKE TO SEE GREATER PROVISION OF LIVELY PURSUITS WHILST OLDER ONES PREFER THE RELATIVE TRANQUILITY OF THEIR EXISTENCE. ONE COMMON PROBLEM WITH WHICH MANY DIVERSE GROUPS ARE BATTLING IS THAT OF DIMINISHING PROVISION AND AVAILABILITY OF PUBLIC TRANSPORT. AS THE PROBLEM BECOMES MORE ACUTE THERE IS LIKELY TO BE A RISING TIDE OF DISSATISFACTION. WHILST THOSE WHO ARE MOBILE CONTINUE TO HAVE THE OPTION OF TRAVELLING TO NORTHAMPTON FOR ENTERTAINMENT, WORK AND SHOPPING THOSE UNFORTUNATES WHO HAVE NO ALTERNATIVE MAY FIND THEMSELVES WITH FEW LOCAL SERVICES AVAILABLE - AS IN THE CASE OF HOLDENBY WHICH HAS RECENTLY LOST ITS VILLAGE SHOP AND POST OFFICE - A REAL BLOW FOR THE ELDERLY RESIDENTS IN PARTICULAR AND THE ENTIRE VILLAGE AS A FOCAL POINT IS DESTROYED.
